CatDescriptText: Alfreda Tyson, boys club worker, Terrace Village and Robert Graswick, delivery boy, Mt. Troy, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 23, 1960, pg. 32 with question: "Do you favor pari-mutuel harness racing in Pennsylvania?" Mrs. Tyson's answer reads: "It would greatly help the income and put a lot of persons to work by bringing more business to Pennsylvania."  Mr. Graswick's answer reads: "Yes, and mainly because it is a good sport."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of Alfreda Tyson wearing long sleeved jacket and matching dress with light colored chain around waist, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Robert Graswick wearing light colored short sleeve striped shirt, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
